trial_identification.studytitle: Repeat prostate evaluation and therapy pilot study in patients undergoing high dose rate brachytherapy for prostate cancer
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A pilot study to evaluate tolerance, safety and efficacy of repeated prostate biopsy in patients undergoing high dose rate brachytherapy for prostate cancer

interventions.interventions: Repeated prostate biopsies are to be obtained from malignant areas identified on previous transrectal ultrasound biopsy. These will be prior to the first high dose rate (HDR) brachytherapy fractions and at various durations prior to the second HDR dose, and again approximately 30 minutes after that dose (i.e. up to 5 biopsies in total).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Unacceptable Toxicity Rate - a composite measure of infection (requiring >5 days of antibiotics), patient tolerance (refusal of subsequent biopsy) and grade 3 toxicity (using NCI CTC criteria)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: presence of prostate tissue on each biopsy assessed using light microscopy

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients undergoing high dose rate brachytherapy for prostate cancer
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: previous transurethral resection of prostate (TURP), anticoagulation, previous sepsis from prostate biopsy

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: St Andrews Pl E Melbourne VIC 3000

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Prostate Cancer Foundation 1250 Fourth Street Santa Monica, CA 90401

ethicsAndSummary.summary: a preliminary study of the ability to obtain tissue before and after radiation therapy (using brachytherapy) for the purpose of studying the molecular and cellular response of the cancer.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: St Andrew Pl E Melbourne VIC 3000
